Sentence: Chanting the choir raised the volume as the celebrant intoned the prayer.

Sentence: A six-month-old calf was submitted for examination, showing lameness in all four legs which had been present since soon after birth.

Sentence: Planning authorities should provide alternative locations for small businesses which are or would be offensive in a residential area.

Sentence: As mentioned, first impressions can be misleading.

Sentence: Executors delay giving information about substantial deviations from agreed dates. Because of this action cannot be taken in time.

Sentence: These glycans are poorly transferred to proteins resulting in unoccupied glycosylation sequons.

Sentence: X is an effective acute, oral treatment for migraine with a rapid onset of action

Sentence: No newspaper is completely unbiased in my expert opinion.

Sentence: Steam for example is just as damaging as acid for that material.

Sentence: My favourite opera composers are Verdi, Puccini, Mozart and Gilbert and Sullivan.

Sentence: The only problem with the new project established in the desert at high cost is the lack of good access roads.

Sentence: Having failed in all previous attempts he evolved a new plan which surprised everybody.

Sentence: When the film was developed none of the pictures proved satisfactory.

Sentence: The school has adequate study facilities but hardly any sports facilities.

Sentence: In his daily traffickings a Cairene resident is often made conscious of the suffocating pollution.

Sentence: If drama implies conflict and poetry metaphor then poetic drama must imply the dramatization of metaphor!

Sentence: Items serve as the nodes of the knowledge network and user-defined relators serve as the links between items.

Sentence: A translator of technical texts often has to handle large amounts of information and needs to ensure that it is stored in an easily retrievable form.

Sentence: The calculator executed the functions that had been selected and displayed the results on the top half of the screen.

Sentence: There are many disturbing factors fatigue, poor eye-sight, poor reading ability, anxiety or undue caution, distractibility, and inadequate motivation.

Sentence: When a source of sound is operating in a room or other enclosure, the sound pressure in the room consists of two components direct sound and reverberant sound.

Sentence: Should any burner fail to ignite its respective section will revert to 'purge' and in this way the system ensures safe removal of unburned fuel

Sentence: At present rates of return giving a net profit of only 7% are widespread in the industry, indicating increased competition and tighter profit margins.

Sentence: He draws an analogy between this and the learning process of a new-born child as it develops into maturity and quotes Freud: "Where id was, there ego shall be."

Sentence: Replace the fuel lines and electrical conduits, which have cracks or damaged B-nut fittings to prevent leaks and ensure safe operation.

Sentence: At high temperatures, all the ceramic materials show ductility and hardness decreases considerably, leading to a higher risk of deformation under load.

Sentence: This produces hard copy that can be retained but printed sheets are bulky to handle, so digital storage and viewing are often preferred.

Sentence: The system consistently achieved 50 gallons per hour optimum output.

Sentence: percentage reduction is critical: over and under reduction cause the ink to be very uneven and prone to smudging.

Sentence: Adopting a user-centered approach is a realistic strategy in the design of both paper and screen based forms.

Sentence: Morphological studies of paraquat or oxygen toxicity in rats have shown significant cellular damage in lung tissue.

Sentence: One should read G. V. Carey’s chapter Proof Correction in Mind the Stop.
